biome.enabled.markdownDescription: Controls whether the Biome extension is active and provides its features in the context to which this setting applies.

biome.configurationPath.markdownDescription:
Specifies the path to a custom Biome configuration file within the workspace folder.

If set to `null`, the extension will fall back to the default Biome configuration files.

biome.suggestInstallingGlobally.markdownDescription:
When a global installation of Biome is required but not found in the `PATH`, the extension will suggest installing it.

This setting controls whether that suggestion popup is shown.

biome.requireConfiguration.description:
Require a Biome configuration file to enable Biome features in the context to which this setting applies.

If set to `true`, the extension will not provide Biome features unless a configuration file is present in the workspace folder.

biome.runFromTemporaryLocation.description:
Whether to copy the Biome binary and run it from a temporary location.

Defaults to `true` on Windows and `false` on other platforms.

oneOf.description:
Path to a custom Biome binary.

When set, the extension will use this path and will not attempt to locate Biome automatically.

Platform-specific paths to a custom Biome binary.

When set, the extension will use the specified path for each matching platform and will not attempt to locate Biome automatically.

biome.lsp.trace.server.description: Sets the tracing level for communication between the extension and the Biome Language Server.

biome.lspBin.description:
(Deprecated) Path to a custom Biome binary.

When set, the extension will use this path and will not attempt to locate Biome automatically.
biome.lspBin.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Please use `biome.lsp.bin` instead.
